перевод:
Grammatical information including
- part of speech
- gender
- verbal information (passive, causative, denominative)
- word derived from
- negatives
- syntax case which the word takes
English meaning of the word within the context of the given example(s), as well as a literal meaning, where relevant.
Russian meaning of the word within the context of the given example(s), as well as a literal meaning, where relevant.

All root-related information, e.g. √gam･1 a (to go)
√ root symbol
√gam Pāḷi root
･ root has an associated verb
× root has no associated verb
1 root group
a conjugational sign
(to go) root meaning

Root Groups
1 √bhū etc. (+ a) bhūvāddigaṇa
2 √rudh etc. (+ ṃ-a) rudhādigaṇa
3 √div etc. (+ ya) divādigaṇa
4 √su etc. (+ ṇo + ṇā + uṇā) svādigaṇa
5 √ki etc. (+ nā) kiyādigaṇa
6 √gah etc. (+ ṇhā) gahādigaṇa
7 √tan etc. (+ o) tanādigaṇa
8 √cur etc. (+ *e + *aya) curādigaṇa
Closest Sanskrit cognate of the headword
Equivalent Sanskrit root, root class and root meaning

Root + Conjugational sign > Base.
Extra information includes the causative, passive, denominative, future and irregular forms

For words derived from a root, e.g. na > a + √kar + ta + tta
prefix(es) + root or base + primary derivative + secondary derivative(s) + case endings

For compound words, e.g. abhi + okāsa + *ika
component word 1 + component word 2 + secondary derivative(s) + case endings
Different form of the same word, either by morphology, different spelling, or a variant reading found in texts
Meaning in context according to the Aṭṭhakathā or Ṭīkā
Notes, comments and information from other sources
Inflected forms of a noun, pronoun, adjective or participle, according to case, number and gender
Inflected forms of a verb, according to tense, person and number

Relevant example of the headword in context.
Sutta number  (DPR Quick Link) and name

Relevant examples of the headword in context.
Sutta number  (DPR Quick Link) and name
Click on any heading or abbreviation to get contextual help.

List of literature used in compiling this dictionary:
(DPD) Digital Pāli Dictionary by Ven. Bodhirasa (mostly based on this source)
(PED) The Pali English Dictionary, Rhys Davids
(MW) Sanskrit-English Dictionary (Monier-Williams)
(BSK) Buddhist Hybrid Sanskrit Grammar and Dictionary
(BD) Concise Pali English Dictionary (Ven. Buddhadatta)
(NCPED) Combination of Concise Pali English Dictionary (Ven. Buddhadatta) and Dictionary of Pali (DoP) by Margaret Cone.
(CPD) Critical Pali Dictionary (V. Trenckner, et al)
(MC) A Dictionary of Pāli (Margaret Cone)
(SCPN) Syntax of the Cases in the Pali Nikayas - Prof. O.H. De A. Wijesekera
(Ñt) Analysis Of The Bhikkhu Pātimokkha (Bhikkhu Ñāṇatusita)
(PDB) Princeton Dictionary of Buddhism
(BDN) Buddhist Dictionary (Ven. Ñāṇatiloka Mahathera)
